sub_topic: Finding the perimeter of a trapezium.
message_1: A trapezium has a length of 5 cm and 8 cm for its parallel sides, while its non-parallel sides both have a length of 4 cm. What is the perimeter of the trapezium?
message_2:
To find the perimeter of the trapezium, we simply add the lengths of all its sides.

Perimeter = (length of first parallel side) + (length of second parallel side) + (length of first non-parallel side) + (length of second non-parallel side)

Perimeter = 5 cm + 8 cm + 4 cm + 4 cm = 21 cm

The perimeter of the trapezium is 21 cm.
